We’re not just a US$70 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. NOTICE FOR PUBLIC
At Lenovo, we follow strict policies and legal compliance for our recruitment process, which includes role alignment, employment terms discussion, final selection and offer approval, and recording transactions in our internal system. Interviews may be conducted via audio, video, or in-person depending on the role, and you will always meet with an official Lenovo representative.
Please beware of fraudulent recruiters posing as Lenovo representatives. They may request cash deposits or personal information. Always apply through official Lenovo channels and never share sensitive information. Lenovo does not solicit money or sensitive information from applicants and will not request payments for training or equipment.
Kindly verify job offers through the official
Lenovo careers page
or contact IndiaTA@lenovo.com. Stay informed and cautious to protect yourself from recruitment fraud. Report any suspicious activity to local authorities.

.
Description and Requirements
Position Description
* Create and coordinate autonomous channel strategies and objectives thru the available sales routes and platforms (TopSeller, Lenovo Partner Hub, Sales Contact Center, etc).
About the position.
* Volume channel business is critical to the success of Lenovo’s strategy to be the most trusted advisor for data center and edge customers.
* Small and medium business customer segment, which this channel motion serves, is an exponentially growing segment.
* Scaling this growth in partnership with the channels has been identified as a key priority.
* This position is offers an excellent opportunity to grow with an organization that drives in owning opportunities and driving breakthrough growth.
* The position reports to the LA Product & SMB 4P Manager for the Lenovo Infrastructure Solutions Group Key
Duties & Responsibilities:
Lenovo ISG autonomous channel Product strategy.
* Ensure the right unit level / mix volume plan for the run rate & autonomous channel business
* Obtain Future Product Road Maps for upcoming offerings from WW for autonomous channel portfolio
* Estimate potential configurations for similar offerings from primary competitor by looking at historical trends by that competitor
* Build and Announce New Configuration with new prices
* Compare with trends in the local market place for work loads and seasonal demand changes
* Provide feedback to WW on local needs and demands
Lenovo ISG autonomous channel Promotion strategy.
* Create and deliver Value Proposals and competitive advantage content for the Lenovo ISG portfolio on the related customer segment.
* Create quarterly Promotions to drive sell through
* Drive demand generation activities a timely manner
Lenovo ISG autonomous channel Price strategy.
* Have right product portfolio enabled
* Price the products and the portfolio to meet revenue and margin plan
* Stablish pricing strategies for autonomous channel business for intelligent pricing tools and TopSellers.
* Overall portfolio profit targets
* Obtain forward looking Cost Tapes for all offerings
Lenovo ISG autonomous channel Place strategy.
* Ensure direct interaction and feedback from Distribution Partners and T2 Partners
* Set unit level volume plan by MTM and track unit level weekly sales into the channel (sales in) and out of the channel (sales out)
Experience:
Engineers Bachelor, Master degree (plus)
5+ years on product management and or brand management. Technology/B2B products related.
Skills:
Spanish Proficiency to Advanced - Capable to work on negotiations and presentations.
English Proficiency to Advanced - Capable to work on negotiations and presentations.

Description and Requirements
Focused on a bold vision: to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy, and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering, and building the world's most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation - to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers worldwide. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!
As an Account Executive for Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG), you'll be responsible for delivering net new account wins across the corporate segment. You will drive revenue and profit to position our company for continued growth and success. You will champion the innovative power of our products to make large enterprise companies more productive, collaborative, and transformative. You will understand Lenovo's portfolio of award-winning products and develop strategies to help new and existing enterprise customers find and implement the best solutions. Within each account, you will have responsibility for selling solutions from our entire data center portfolio, including Hyperconverged infrastructure, IOT/Edge devices, Software, storage systems, professional services, networking, and servers.
This client-facing sales role requires deep industry experience, the ability to identify, cultivate, and close net new business, and expertise in working large deals at the C level. We are looking for a hunter with a successful and proven track record to take their career and the territory to the next level.
The position is to work from home with travel to customer sites for meetings. The successful candidate will be located in the New England territory.
The candidate will have extensive large enterprise and Data Center Infrastructure sales experience.
Key Responsibilities:
• Independently identify, develop, and close new large enterprise opportunities across multiple verticals with current clients and acquisition accounts in the territory.
• Achieve revenue and profitability objectives for Lenovo while driving growth across multiple products sets
• Independently develop, implement, and execute an effective sales strategy to achieve sales goals
• Develop C-level relationships and serve as a trusted consultant to customers
• Understand and adapt to Lenovo's ongoing product and services developments
• Lead a cross-functional team within the company to keep deals moving through the funnel
• Act as a Client Executive and coordinate peer specialist customer engagement across our server, workstation, and server groups, among others
• Ensure that our customers receive world-class sales and customer service
• Effectively and consistently use Salesforce.com and other reporting tools to track key sales metrics and consistently meet those metrics
Basic qualifications:
• BA/BS degree or equivalent professional work experience.
• 5+ years of successful Enterprise technology sales are required.
Preferred qualifications:
• Demonstrated track record of top performance with multi-million dollar quota.
• Executive relationship within account set within the target market
• Proven experience dealing with C-level executives
• Proven ability to develop strategies to penetrate and sell to large companies.
• Ability to travel to any or all customer sites when appropriate.
• Deep knowledge of enterprise customer set in the designated territory
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Description and Requirements
■Abstract - A project leader for software for Embedded Controller that help differentiate NECPC LAVIE hardware products. ■About Organization - Organization Name: HW Design Team - Report to : 1 - Subordinates : 6 - Number of Peers (excluding contractors): 6 The HW Design Team is developing NEC brand notebook PCs (including 2-in1 and convertible) at the Yonezawa Plant. This team is in charge of electrical design & embedded SW(BIOS/EC) of PC motherboard and design work of the entire PC system in collaboration with other teams. ■Roles and responsibilities - Lead a software development for Embedded Controller - Make a plan for development and track status to align with product schedule - Understands the market/customer requirements properly and interprets them in architect/high level design of embedded SW(BIOS/EC) for motherboard of PCs - Lead detailed functional design of embedded SW(BIOS/EC) and define technical spec.(software IF & user IF)  - Leads actually performs the debugging and evaluation of their embedded SW(BIOS/EC) - Lead and/or actually performs problem resolution - Communicates with HW design team to optimize motherboard design - Communicates with OS & Application team to optimize SW IF & User IF of embedded SW(BIOS/EC) - Communicates with Device team to optimize the implementation of subsystems from embedded SW point view - Communicate with Worldwide NECPC development team and external ODM companies to support their development activities - Report the development status to the project manager and the people manager ■Key Interaction with: -In-house: Planning department, Production department, Quality Assurance Department -Outside the company: ODM, SW Vendor, Chipset vender   ■概要 - NECPC LAVIE製品に付加価値を与えるエンベデットコントローラーのソフトウェア開発のプロジェクトをリードしていただきます ■組織について - Organization Name: HW Design Team - Report to : 1 - Subordinates : 6 - Number of Peers (excluding contractors): 6 HW デザインチームは、米沢事業場でNEC ブランドのノートブックPC(2-in1やコンバーチブルを含む)の開発を行っています。ノートブックPCのマザーボードの電気設計および組み込みソフトウェアの設計、他のチームと協業してPCシステム全体の設計業務を担当するチームです ■職務内容 - エンベデットソフトウェア開発プロジェクトをリードする - プロジェクトのスケジュールに則った開発計画を立て、進捗を管理する - お客様やマーケティング部門からの要件を適切に理解し、パーソナルコンピュータの組み込みソフトウェアの設計を行う - ソフトウェアの機能設計(ソフトウェア I/F、ユーザI/F)、詳細設計を行い、技術仕様書を作成する - 単体テストの実施、または社外開発委託チームへの指示を行なう - NECPCのHW開発チームと協業して組み込みソフトウェアの最適化を行う - NECPCのソフトウェア（OS,アプリケーション）チームと協業してソフトウェア I/F、ユーザI/Fの最適化を行う - NECPC社外の技術者と協業し、組み込みソフトウェアの最適化を行う - 海外のNECPC開発チームや社外の開発委託チームと協業し、NECPCの開発業務をサポートする - プロジェクトマネジャー・ピープルマネジャーに対して、開発状況の報告を行なう ■Key Interaction with: - 社内：企画部門、生産部門、品質保証部門 - 社外：ODM、S/W Vendor、Chipset Vendor Must Have - essential - 5+ year experience in professional software development - Experience in leading a project to ship a software product in the market - Experience in SW Programing and Analysis with debugger - Communication skills in Business English (TOEIC score 500+) - Strong communication and presentation skills - ５年以上のソフトウェア開発実務経験 - プロジェクトリードとしてソフトウェアを顧客にリリースされた経験 - デバッグツール(デバッガ)を用いたソフトウェア解析経験を有する - 一般的な会話が可能な英語力 （目安：TOEIC 500点以上） - 平均以上のコミュニケーション・プレゼンテーション能力 Good to have - desirable - Experience in PC embedded SW design & development more than 7 years - Development experience of C, C++ and SW on Windows - Project management in software development - Understanding PC architecture - Understanding Windows architecture - Work experience at oversea - パーソナルコンピュータのファームウェアまたはソフトウェアの設計・開発の経験が7年以上 - C、C++などを使用したソフトウェア開発業務の経験が5年以上ある - Responsibilities and Duties:
Work with internal & external stake holders to analyze AD, ADAS, IVI related key software technologies, including yet not limited to bootloader, MCAL, device driver, hypervisor, diverse OSes middleware and application/function software
Understand software technology trend and support internal technology roadmap building and product definition work

Why Work at Lenovo
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
www.lenovo.com
, and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
Description and Requirements
Would you like to join our team of HPC/AI team of engineers at Lenovo to drive leadership with the next generation of both air and liquid-cooled high-performance computational platforms?
To achieve our mission, we are seeking a driven and innovative Advisory HPC Performance & Acceptance Engineer focused on putting our systems through rigorous testing at scale.
This high impact role requires solid technical and personal skills as well as the ability to collaborate effectively across multiple teams and with customers. In this role, you will be responsible for running commercial, open source and some home-grown applications across a variety of processor and accelerator technologies. These skills will be used to support acceptance testing activity once a solution has been delivered to a customer site as well as to support the Lenovo HPC sales team with identifying the ideal technology for a given workload. These deliverables are critical to Lenovo’s ability to deliver large-scale, high-performance computation efficiently and effectively in some of the world’s largest Supercomputers.
You will also interface with key stakeholders both inside and outside Lenovo to ensure systems meet performance expectations and that the teams are designing and offering the best solutions possible.
You will report in to the HPC Performance and Benchmarking team supporting customers globally. You will participate in a combination of virtual and in person meetings with fellow team members, sellers, architects and customers. There may be occasions when customer site attendance is required. The goal is to help ensure customer system performance meets expectations and to select the right technologies for their unique needs.
What else is waiting for you in this role?
Investigate and resolve computational performance issues related to HPC applications and Lenovo servers.
Support Lenovo professional services with running acceptance testing and solving performance issues on cluster new systems.
Interact with customers and the Lenovo sales team to offer insight into workload performance characteristics that drive system configurations.
Deliver acceptance testing reports to support closure of projects.
Support performance and benchmarking activities prior to customer bid submission.
Develop seller enablement collateral for Lenovo Sellers and Business Partners, and participate in sales enablement activities.
Attend conferences and workshops relevant to HPC and stay current with HPC trends
What do we expect from you?
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant experience.
5+ years of experience working with Linux.
5+ years of working with scientific code and performance tuning.
5+ years of experience of scripting and coding, with specific experience of more than one of: Bash, Python, C++, C, Fortran.
5+ years of experience with High Performance Computing technology, including servers, Infiniband interconnects, accelerators, and storage solutions.
3+ years of experience of using parallel applications using OpenMP or MPI.
3+ years of experience of running performance and benchmarking codes, with specific experience of more than one of: HPL, Stream, IMB/OSU, MLperf, ior, mdtest.
3+ years of experience of large-scale filesystems (ideally Spectrum Scale), batch scheduling (ideally SLURM) as well as common HPC SW and management tools.
3+ years of experience of using parallel and/or accelerated applications using more than one of OpenMP, MPI, CUDA, ROCm, OpenCL, SYCL.
Knowledge of networking and security practices.
Ability to work under deadlines.
Problem solving and critical thinking skills.
A proven track record for developing value propositions around technology, with strong presentation skills for both external and internal engagements.
Innovative and a willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment.
What We Will Offer You:
Your experience working for ISG at Lenovo will be exciting, innovating, and challenging. The ISG commitment to PeopleFirst is focused on Employee Experience, Leadership, and One Team, all driving operational excellence and providing you supportive resources to launch your professional career.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Position Description:
Self-motivated individual who is responsible for technical support for the Lenovo Global eCommerce applications/tools including automating solutions to advance our IT offerings and vision. Work with broad cross functional teams like Web Architecture, Product Owner and Software Development to understand business direction and requirements and assist in operational solutions to address those needs. Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will take full ownership of the IT operations functional aspects. We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic DevOps Engineer who has the following qualities and responsibilities:
•             Develop scripts to automate day-to-day operation processes which require manual work.
Support the application CI/CD pipeline for promoting software into higher environments
•             Manage operation day-to-day technical issues.
•             Troubleshooting, root causing, perform web platform administration activities ensuring issues are resolved in timely fashion within agreed SLA.
•             Perform site performance monitoring to determine system performance bottlenecks and Root Cause Analysis.
•             Proactive learner with the ability to research and quickly utilize new technologies.
•             Work with other cross-functional and enterprise-wide organizations to develop system and process enhancements.
•             Understand business requirements, both current and future, and design automation solutions to achieve the business directives.

OS – Linux, Unix
Data Sources – MySQL, Mongo, Redis.
Source Control – GIT
Test and Build systems – Jenkins
Web Servers - Nginx, Tomcat,
Micro Services architecture
Containerization tools - Docker, Kubernetes.

Strong scripting and automation skills – Perl / Python / Java / Bash / Shell / Ansible / Chef / Helm / Terraform
Network – F5, Firewall, Load Balancing, Reverse Proxy, DNS, DMZ, etc.
Security – SSL, Web security scans, Checksum, etc.
Cloud technologies – AWS, Azure
Position Requirements:
Bachelor of Computer Science / Information Technology from a reputable university/college with a minimum 5 years of working experience in IT Application Devops.
Passionate with Technical IT work and adopting new technologies.
Experience in managing Linux based infrastructure.
Hands-on experience at least in one scripting language.
Hands-on experience with databases including MySQL, Mongo, Redis.
Knowledge of Java/JVM based languages.
Knowledge and experience of working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
Knowledge in CI/CD processes
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
Good teamwork.
Good time-management skills.
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Full-time position.

Responsibility:
Responsible for the management of Lenovo personal computer after-sale spare parts reverse center, including but not limited to:
1. Improve the screening capacity of reverse center suppliers, improve the screening accuracy and lead time, and shorten the spare parts supply lead time.
2. Participate in the establishment, set up and review reverse center third-party supplier’s process.
3. Cooperate with the planning team and local region teams to predict the return quantity of defective products, coordinate the overall reverse capacity, and reduce the return time and cost of defective parts.
4. Monitor the quality of repaired spare parts, check and solve related quality issues.

1. Bachelor degree or above, major in computer, electronics or related field is preferred
2. Supply chain related working experience is preferred

4. Strong ability of multi-party communication and problem solving

WW Alliance Partner Marketing Manager for Intel
The role requires ongoing collaboration with various WW ISG Marketing and BU/Segment teams, plus the Alliance partner, to define strategic GTM objectives, plans, and FY KPIs.
This role draws heavily on your past experience effectively engaging with higher level executives, managing past Alliance/ “MDF” relationships, managing GTM plans, KPIs and leading cross-functional efforts to drive awareness and demand plays in B2B multi-channel campaigns.
This role has the unique privilege of collaborating with Lenovo and senior-level executives within Lenovo ISG and with the Alliance partner.

Lead the
global marketing relationship
with the WW Alliance
Excel in
communicating and presenting
to senior-level executives (in English), as well as creating Powerpoint presentations

joint WW ISG + Alliance GTM marketing plan
with specific KPIs based on Alliance’s annual MDF funding to ISG

Monitor and present Alliance’s quarterly
Marketing Performance Dashboard KPIs
, which also requires a proactive understanding of ISG’s state of business with the Alliance

calls with key WW ISG & WW Alliance stakeholders

cross-functional GTM projects
and associated project plans
Proactively engage with ISG Geography marketing teams through a
WW governance council
process as it relates to the WW Alliance GTM plan

routine marketing interlock calls
throughout the year
Subject matter expert in
Alliance’s MDF requirements, Proof of Execution and branding requirements

MDF budget planning process and routine Alliance interlocks
.  Also includes submitting MDF expense line items for pre-approval prior to any content creation.

ead engagement with

, when necessary

meetings/meeting management

Alliance KPI Marketing Performance Dashboard:
Manage quarterly insights, trends and deliver quarterly presentation to Alliance executives and internal ISG stakeholders.

WW Awareness and Demand Gen campaigns
: Based on annual Alliance WW GTM Marketing Plan, collaborate with WW ISG Solutions Marketing team & other WW Marketing stakeholders to develop joint Awareness and Demand Gen campaigns using Alliance MDF funding.
Lead overall project management with Alliance and ISG Solutions Marketing & other WW Marketing stakeholders to define campaign objectives, messaging, content strategy, content development, event plans, social media plans, web marketing plans.  Lend hands-on assistance, wherever needed.

Sales mindset

Degree in Information Technology, System Engineering or similar subjects or equivalent work experience
PC architecture knowledge and In depth knowledge of current and former operating systems (Microsoft, Linux)
Strong communication and presentation skills - You know how to connect with customers and have the ability to work at different levels and to manage multiple customer situations
Excellent English skills, outside of Country language.
Flexible, proactive & high customer orientation
Enhanced cross-functional team working capabilities and collaborative working style and high commitment to get the job done
Be proactive, quick and bold & innovative in all you do

Description and Requirements
Team Overview
This is a friendly and dynamic team of about a dozen researchers and engineers with very diverse background and strong technical expertise. We incorporate converging technologies into both existing and new products that take us beyond today’s most advanced products: smartphones, tablets, PCs, and other electronic devices. We perform research and system integration of software and hardware to deliver exciting products utilizing artificial intelligence, computer vision, natural language processing, context awareness, connectivity, authentication & security, as well as other relevant research areas.
What You’ll Do
You will join the Mobile Technology Innovation team in Lenovo Research, an advanced research and technology group within Lenovo . You will be working with a group of experienced colleagues on one or more of the current research projects. You will participate in regular team meetings, brainstorming sessions, team building events, and other company activities. You will have opportunities to contribute to the business by solving actual technical problems with innovative idea, try out your idea by writing code and testing your code, file patent applications, and make technical presentations.

Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform adhering to best practices.
Integrate machine learning algorithms into the android platform and application-level features.
Analyze image quality solution requirement to add components in the Android Camera Pipeline
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design and ship new features.

1. 负责图形显示框架的优化；

职位要求：

Why Work at Lenovo
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
www.lenovo.com
, and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
Description and Requirements
Position Description:
Lenovo is a US $70 billion Global Fortune 500 company and a leader in providing innovative consumer, commercial and enterprise technologies. Globally, our product lines include a full range of commercial and consumer PCs, servers and workstations, and a family of mobile internet devices including tablets and smart phones. We design and build our products to bring progress to the world. Serving customers in more than 180 markets, we take our inspiration from the drive and imagination of the people who make things happen; our technology helps those who do, do better.
At Lenovo we employ more than 71,500 employees worldwide and our people share a common aspiration to be the very best. Whether serving our customers, working as a team or contributing to the community, we are working to build a unique company. A company that delivers unparalleled products created and supported by people with a wealth of different cultures and experiences. Our strength lies in this diversity. We are dedicated to fostering an environment that encourages entrepreneurism and ownership. A workplace where people's talents can be challenged and their efforts recognized and rewarded. We employ fantastic people…come join the fun!
About Role:
As a Smart Collaboration Global Accounts BDM for Lenovo, you will be responsible for driving Collaboration Transformation opportunities within the Global Accounts segment. Within each account, you will have responsibility for selling solutions from our entire Collaboration Transformation portfolio. From these sales, you will drive revenue and profit to position our company for continued growth and success. You will champion the innovative power of our products to make our customers more productive, collaborative and transformative. You will understand Lenovo’s portfolio of award-winning Collaboration Transformation solutions and develop strategies to help new and existing partners find and implement the best solutions.
This is a partner-client facing, high-growth sales role requiring deep industry experience, the ability to identify, cultivate, and close net new business, and expertise working large deals at the C level. We are looking for a hunter skill-set with a successful and proven track record to take their career, the territory, and our clients to the next level. The candidate must be able to position Lenovo product and channel value proposition. A strong working knowledge of Large Corporate Relationship accounts and of the AV Resellers, Distribution & various channel strategies is preferred. The successful candidate will have 10+ years proven track record in strategic selling, acquisition, and account management, strong interpersonal and communications skills, demonstrated team building, leadership and the ability to manage multiple complex sales engagements concurrently. Candidate must have an entrepreneurial approach that is imaginative, smart, passionate, and approachable. This position will require travel, estimated at 50%. Location is Singapore.
Responsibilities:
Build partnerships      with existing, current and new Smart Collaboration Expert partners by      coordinating the efforts of sales, opportunity management, marketing and      pre and post sales technical support to maximize Revenue and Margin for      Lenovo Workplace Transformation products.
Act as pre-sale and      support the initial phase of the sales process for relationship account      managers, especially for Global Account customers.
Build & execute      operational plans for Collaboration Transformation products and options.
Own ongoing analysis      of metrics & business performance to produce weekly report for      Collaboration Transformation business performance & relevant actions      and recommendations.
Assess & mitigate      risks / issues through effective contingency plans.
Plan and execute      acquisition activities in the Collaboration Transformation area in      agreement with sales / account teams
Position Requirements:
Minimum 7 years      business development, or sales / marketing experience in the IT industry      (software and hardware) or AV industry
Proficient in being      able to sell the value of Collaboration Transformation & associated      solutions; understands Collaboration Transformation & associated      solutions technology and its practical application/ contribution to      customers’ requirements, as well as the market’s collaboration tools      ecosystem
Project management      skills
Negotiation and      communication skills
Experience in working      with Fortune 500 accounts
Strong relationship      building skills
Excellent verbal and      written communications skills
Superior presentation      skills
Territory management      skills

Description and Requirements
Motorola’s Integrated Marketing team is seeking an Integrated Marketing Specialist to join our North America team.
About Us
The Integrated Marketing team is responsible for:
Developing the Motorola marketing strategy to align with the overall business goals while ensuring execution is on-time and on-budget
Building brand awareness, consideration and preference.
Delivering cohesive marketing communications with operational excellence
Measuring and reporting the successes of multiple areas of the marketing
Helping the team make strategic and data driven decisions to achieve our goals
About You
You have a passion for marketing and interest in data, reporting and drawing conclusions.
You are organized, diligent and detail-oriented with strong communication skills.
You are the type of person that takes initiative, exudes a positive attitude and willingness to help the team!
Responsibilities:
Helping drive new product launches by defining key selling points, tracking launch dates and creating marketing kickoff decks.
Tracking and reporting on competitors' new product launches, marketing investments, market analysis and insights.
Monitoring and reporting consumer feedback through NPS and consumer reviews to draw insights and improvements to the current and future portfolio.
Reviewing and sharing marketing insights and trends to entire marketing team.
Requirements:
College graduate with a degree in Marketing, Advertising or a related field, some internship experience preferred.
Proficient in Google Sheets and Excel
Comfortable and flexible working in a fast-paced environment with firm deadlines
Strong slide-building and presentation skills (PowerPoint, Google Slides)
Quick learner with the ability to solve problems independently or with little guidance
Strong communication skills to work across teams and manage initiatives
Ability to craft a story leveraging data and analysis and present recommendations to both technical and non-technical audience
Nice to have:
Interest in Technology or Telecommunications

Description and Requirements
We are seeking a Program Specialist, to partner with the After Point of Sale (APOS) Leadership and assist in defining, launching, and executing on our key strategic programs for the Global APOS (Renewals) business. This individual will collaborate effectively with internal end-users and cross-functional teams to support new programs and deliver successfully against high standards
Main Responsibilities:
This position will work with stakeholders supporting the extended APOS Business Team, such as Sales, Service Operations, Business Development, Marketing, Business Transformation, IT, and the Partner team.
Current and ongoing work spans the following areas: transactional and relationship notifications for Consumer and Commercial APOS opportunities, vendor management, marketing technology awareness, messaging and merchandising for promotional content, and forecasting/performance management of the program.
Plans and coordinates the development, implementation, and execution of sub-programs, special projects, and other initiatives designed to achieve the overall mission, goals, and objectives of the program.
Oversees and administers all facets of the day-to-day operations of the various programs and activities related to the position.
Serves as a liaison with internal stakeholders on all matters relating to program activities.
Establish      ways to measure and track metrics related to adoption of the service, and      to make improvements to the approach based on those measurements
Prepare      and give business reviews to the cross functional stakeholders regarding      progress and metrics
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is      required.
3+ years of experience in project management,      sales strategy, automated marketing programs, data management/analysis for      audience segmentation, and vendor management
Experience in program support and the data      background tied to business objectives
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to manage multiple workstreams,      varying timelines, and a variety of inputs from stakeholders
Strong verbal and written communications      skills and ability to articulate details of programs, process, and plans      to various audiences.
Excellent cross group collaboration skills.
The ideal candidate has skill sets in business      acumen, sales and Go To Market (GTM) strategy experience, automated      marketing program design/execution, and an analytical background.
Be able to operate successfully in a rapidly      changing and ambiguous environment.
The base salary range for this position in Colorado, New York City, Nevada and Washington, is $75,000 - $85,000. Individuals may also be considered for bonus and/or commission. Lenovo’s various benefits can be found on
www.lenovobenefits.com
.

Why Work at Lenovo
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
www.lenovo.com
, and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
Description and Requirements
Lenovo (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY) is a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
https://www.lenovo.com
,
and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
We are seeking an experienced Sales Representative to join our National Consumer Retail team.  Reporting to the Consumer Director, you will be part of the national retail team representing Lenovo within Australia's major retailers at a store level. This role will see you responsible for managing a set territory of major retail stores in Australia including some regional areas and is ideally suited to someone who is successful in a high performance, fast paced, results driven dynamic environment.
Key responsibilities include:
Manage assigned      territory/accounts to support Lenovo brand in store sales, product      training, merchandising and retail trade events
Proactively and consultatively      managing retail inventory, training and in store brand merchandising in      major retail accounts
Conduct field visits in store to      build and manage long term retail client relationships
Conduct product training with      external retail sales representatives driving business outcomes
Coordinate merchandising ensuring      appropriate promotional displays
Maintain administrative duties      and reporting required for the role
To be considered for this role you will need:
A proven track record in a      similar role or industry
Several years’ experience in a      retail sales environment
Strong relationship, planning and      analytical skills
Experience in delivering product      training to groups as well as one on one
Strong communication and      presentation skills along with the ability to relay key business      information to all key stakeholders (internal and external)
The ability to review and analyse      inventory and sales performance reports
Experience as a brand      representative in the consumer electronics or computer hardware industry      is preferred
We are looking for a self-starter      with strong written and verbal communication skills who is efficient and      can manage time effectively
Must have own car and valid      driver’s license
Your strong product knowledge coupled with a business outcomes approach will be vital to your success in this role.  As will your drive, energy, passion and solid relationship building skills experience to offer exceptional levels of service and partner with our customers.
* Andorra

A strong personality with the desire to reach high performance goals is a must.
Who You’ll Work With: At Lenovo, we manufacture one of the world’s widest portfolios of connected products, including PCs (ThinkPad, Yoga, Lenovo Legion), tablets, smartphones and workstations as well as augmented and virtual reality (Mirage, ThinkReality) and smart home/office solutions, software and services. Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.
IDG (Intelligent Device Group) - The IDG at Lenovo houses our PC and Smart Devices. We combine investment in high-growth segments (workstations, gaming, visuals, thin and light devices) with new innovation in the smart device categories and continue to explore new opportunities across AR/VR, artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), security and as-a-service solutions.
What You'll Do: This acquisition focused Inside Sales Account Representative will work with Field Account Execs and end-user customers within Quebec, Canada to drive opportunities and education around Lenovo's portfolio offerings. Account Representatives will support configuration discussions and provide solutions as well as proactive follow-up, product information and overall account support via the telephone. The Inside Sales Account Representatives will also work within the segments initiatives including weekly forecast and opportunity management, outbound calls and weekly program follow ups with the partners.
Basic Requirements:
3+ years of professional inside or outside sales experience in a technology field or IT Industry is required.
Post-secondary degree required
Must have experience in a quota carrying sales position before.
Fully Bilingual in French and English (verbal and written)
Preferred Requirements
Ability to penetrate, acquire and transition opportunities.
Working knowledge of IT industry, experience with computer-based programs, ability to learn and present hardware portfolio
Excellent verbal/ written communication skills
What’s in it for you?
Opportunities for continued sales training.
High-growth potential and career advancement within Lenovo.
An inclusive, flexible, and collaborative work environment that focuses on leveraging your unique skills.
Incentives to reward your strong performance and big wins.
This is a full-time opportunity in an energetic work environment with opportunities for advancement. Representatives are paid a competitive salary. Benefits include company paid training, paid vacation, medical, dental, vision, paid time-off for volunteerism and discounts on award-winning products such as the Lenovo ThinkPad and Yoga. Why Lenovo? Lenovo is a US $50 billion Fortune Global 500 company, with 57,000 employees and operating in 180 markets around the world. We are #1 PC company on the planet, BCG's 50 most innovative companies, and one of Interbrand’s 100 BEST global brands.
Awards & Recognition:

Description and Requirements
At Lenovo, we are focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy, and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering, and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation - to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!
Premier Technical Support is a new and exciting Lenovo division. As a Premier Technical Support Specialist, you will work with customers in resolving technical issues beyond the standard level one support most provide. In this role, you be delivering our best-in-class support to Lenovo’s customers. As part of your work, you will provide support via email and phone while accurately diagnosing reported problems within our client’s product environment (notebooks, desktops, and tablets), dispatching parts and service to customer sites as needed. You will also be handling customer escalations with support from our Level 2 Engineers and Technical Account Managers as needed. The ideal candidate will be highly technical and have an inner drive to learn even more as part of a growing team.
Job Responsibilities:
Assist customers and field engineers      by diagnosing problems and providing resolutions for technical or      service-related issues
Troubleshoot to identify hardware      and software issues in many different customer environments
Advise and educate customers through      a combination of experience/documentation to ensure a solution
Translate complex technical      details/instructions to each customer’s level
Provide closed loop feedback on      recurring issues with teammates and relevant engineering staff
Work with Technical Account Managers      (TAM) to monitor and track issues to ensure accurate resolution
Actively monitor case workload and      drive closure within SLA’s
Basic Qualifications:
Degree in IT/Computer Science or related technology field, or equivalent experience
1-3 years of experience in Hardware support
1-3 years of experience in troubleshooting hardware (PC, Laptop, Tablet, ect.)
1-3 years of experience in troubleshooting software/OS (Windows OS, Linux)
Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills

Description and Requirements
About Our Team
We are hiring a
BIOS
Firmware Engineer
to work in Lenovo's Cloud Service Provide Group (CSP). This is a fast-paced customer-centric organization that will adapt to changing market demands to serve customer needs. We're the only company with true end-to-end capabilities for even the most unique datacenter computing solution. Our CSP solutions can be designed, manufactured, tested, serviced and deployed worldwide using only Lenovo teams and without any other JDM support required at any stage of the product lifecycle.
Location:
This position can be remote or based in Monterrey, MX.
What You'll Do
Support System Integration projects with the factory.
Debug and solve issues quickly. 80% debug (include meeting with customer and factory) and 20% development
Work closely with customer engineering teams and Lenovo sales and marketing teams to extract and understand customer requirements in order to drive server designs/architectures, node/rack/scale level test plans, cable mappings, rack configurations, serviceability, manageability, etc.
Create specifications and collateral that define the next generation hyperscale platforms
Lead CSP development team to work out the design proposals with --Product and system spec --System architecture and placement --Demonstrate Lenovo design and engineering capability --Game plan and development strategy to win customer and business
Lead engagement with suppliers and partners of hardware building blocks such as storage devices, network controllers, FPGAs, encryption/accelerator devices, GPUs and other emerging technology hardware devices
Continue to promote innovation within Lenovo and the computing industry by filing new patents annually
Own end-to-end product delivery (power point to production) from pre-concept to launch of platforms
Work closely with validation engineering team, systems engineering team and manufacturing engineering team to drive issues found during test to closure between commodity vendor and customer
Help identify areas of testing that could be automated and work with validation/script team to implement automation
Help TPMs define development and test schedules
Minimum Qualifications:
Undergraduate BSEE or BSCE degree required
5+ years or more work experience in server and hardware development/validation with thorough understanding of computer hardware/firmware/software architecture
Proficiency scripting in powershell, python, perl, bash, batch, etc.
Experience with  oscilloscopes, protocol analyzers, host bus adapters, meters, and other test equipment to debug HW/SW/FW issues
Preferred Qualifications:
A Master’s degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering is a plus.
Hyperscale/Cloud experience
Experience in direct customer engagements
Ability to understand customer requirements; interpret these requirements and convert them into a competitive CSP platform portfolio
Deep knowledge of X86 Intel server architecture (BIOS/ME/BMC/HW Sequencing/Control, etc.)
Thorough understanding of PCIe, SAS/SATA, I2C/I3C, SPI, eSPI/LPC, PMBUS/SMBUS, CAN and other commonly used communication buses
Knowledge of design elements of OCP (Open Compute Project) based HW is a plus
Proficiency with Linux server operating systems
Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation
Ability to interface with Lenovo and customer executives
Willingness to travel domestically and internationally
Ability to work effectively cross-culturally across teams in the USA, Asia and Mexico
*Please submit your resume in English*

Description and Requirements
About Our Team
This position is for a CSP (Cloud Service Provider)
BOM EC Engineer
in the Lenovo Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG). This is an exciting role in the CSP Development organization that has a strong focus to be the #1 trusted IT Partner in the Data Center. ISG is innovating the future-defined data center, today. From the simplest to the most complex IT environments for all types of workloads, our servers, storage, networking and solutions help maximize the potential of data centers.
What You'll Do
The BOM EC Engineer will work on Customer BOM/EC enablement including data releases, IT system enablement, EC releases and label EC management.
Additionally, this role will also require end-to-end data enablement with customers and Lenovo's internal teams, including engineering and manufacturing data enablement.
• Work with global teams to define shipment features and specs
• Build Product CTO BOM and MECH.BOM correctly
• Create BOM/EC data release plan and track data readiness
• Closely work with related functional teams to ensure E2E data accuracy
• Resolve BOM/EC issues
Minimum Requirements
:
• Bachelor's degree in an engineering or technical discipline
• 5+ years BOM/EC working experience in server and hardware development
Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience in direct customer engagements
• Masters degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering is a plus
• Hyperscale/Cloud experience a plus
• Strong MS Excel experience, formulas, data manipulation, VBA
• Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation
• Ability to interface with Lenovo and customer
• Strong leadership skills with the ability to lead teams and have the autonomy to make decisions
• Willingness to travel domestically and internationally
• Ability to work effectively cross-culturally across teams in the US and Asia

About Lenovo
Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society. By designing, engineering and building the world’s most complete portfolio of smart devices and infrastructure, we are also leading an Intelligent Transformation - to create better experiences and opportunities for millions of customers around the world. Join us in defining our world of tomorrow and creating smarter technology for all!
Who You’ll Work With - Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
Lenovo’s data center solutions (ThinkSystem, ThinkAgile) are creating the capacity and computing power for the connections that are changing business and society.
Lenovo Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) is a smart infrastructure solutions provider to organizations of all sizes.
Our technology and insight power the data-centered heart of smarter retail, smarter manufacturing, smarter cities, smarter healthcare, smarter finance, and beyond. Through edge and cloud computing, analytics and artificial intelligence, and Infrastructure-As-a-Service via TruScale, we deliver Smarter Technology for All. We’re the only data center provider with end-to-end manufacturing. We own our entire supply chain for everything we build, to deliver a level of security and seamlessness that no one else can, anywhere in the world.
ISG offerings include:
#1 on Top500 Supercomputing list. Lenovo now has TOP500 systems in 17 markets
#1 in Lenovo ThinkSystem server reliability for 7 consecutive years
Delivered products to 6 of the top 10 hyperscalers in the world
Shipped more than 12,000 SAP HANA systems worldwide
First-to-market with 2nd Generation Intel® Xeon® Scalable processors (“Cascade Lake”) on ThinkAgile HX portfolio. 17 of the top 25 research universities in the world run Lenovo
1 in 3 supercomputers run Lenovo. Lenovo is a leader in liquid cooling for those servers.
Role and Responsibilities
Lenovo Manufacturing Engineering Team is looking for a Manufacturing Engineer, a professional that can support the manufacturing line of ISG products. Position Requirements Bachelor’s degree in IT related field, Industrial Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering, solid knowledge in BOM control and product manufacturing support. Knowledge of Hardware (Computer Architecture – x86 Servers) is a plus. Fluent/Advanced in English to report problems and shared inputs in our global and multinational team. Problem-solving skills and proactive attitude is a must to have.

Candidate must be pro-active and highly self-motivated

Project administration.
SAP (preferred), MySQL, Excel (required)
High-Pressure Tolerance.
Flexibility in working hours

Description and Requirements
Location:
Whitsett, NC
Department:
Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG)
Schedule:
Full-time, Onsite, First Shift (occasional weekends/holidays)
About Lenovo
Lenovo is a global technology leader known for innovation in PCs, servers, mobile devices, and smart solutions. You can be part of a global leader in technology and innovation, working on cutting-edge server platforms and manufacturing systems while collaborating with top talent across engineering, logistics, and operations and enjoying a dynamic work culture with opportunities for growth and impact.
At our US Fulfillment Center in Whitsett, NC, we drive excellence in manufacturing and logistics to support our Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG).
Role Summary
The Manufacturing Test Infrastructure Support Engineer is responsible for the setup, maintenance, and optimization of server test environments and equipment across manufacturing operations. This role ensures robust test infrastructure, supports cross-functional collaboration, and provides technical training to enhance operational readiness and product quality.
Key Responsibilities
Test Network & Server Setup
Build and configure test network environments including switches, PXE boot systems, and rack cabling.
Set up and maintain test servers (L1/L2) used in automated and manual validation processes.
Issue Debugging & Reporting
Document and escalate issues with detailed root cause analysis and resolution tracking.
Equipment Procurement & Management
Identify, evaluate, and procure test-related equipment including HiPot testers, racks, and diagnostic tools.
Maintain inventory and ensure quality and calibration of test equipment across production lines.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Work closely with engineering, quality, IT, and logistics teams to ensure seamless test operations.
Participate in design reviews and provide feedback on testability and infrastructure needs.
Training & Documentation
Provide technical training to team members and technicians on test setup, equipment usage, and safety protocols.
Develop and maintain SOPs and troubleshooting guides for test infrastructure.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in server hardware testing or manufacturing test support.
Proficiency in Linux system administration, network configuration (DHCP, FTP, SSH), and scripting (Python, Bash).
Familiarity with manufacturing test platforms like UTP and server validation processes (AVT, Burn-In, FVT).
Strong analytical and communication skills with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Additional Skills
Experience with L1/L2 server architecture and PXE boot automation.
Understanding of test data visualization and benchmarking tools.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional manufacturing environment.

Description and Requirements
Thinking of a starting your career at Lenovo? Check this out!
We are Lenovo! Currently the number one PC vendor worldwide, we continue to be the fastest growing company in our respective field. Leading the way in innovation globally, Lenovo is looking to build and expand its success through attracting new talent. We are dedicated to fostering an environment that encourages entrepreneurship and ownership - a workplace where your talents can be challenged, and your efforts recognised and rewarded.
We are looking for a number of students to learn a professional role within our industry, we take pride in having successful individuals in our technical business with a wide offering of skills and attributes, we are also keen to develop and retain the successful students for the future.
Position Overview
* Maintaining the execution/ business plans based on the BPT (Business Planning Tool) inputs from the retail account teams for all categories.
* Maintaining the week-on-week changes in BPT and keeping a roadmap of changes.
* Become the BPT expert within the consumer team.
* Supporting the 4P team in managing the promotion calendar
* Ensuring promos are executed go live in a timely fashion within the retailers
* Building co-data reports and sharing insights/reports that can be shared with the sales teams ahead of the consumer sales report
* Identifying trends in weekly/monthly GFK/IDC data and heat map data.
This role will be an excellent opportunity to learn about category management within the consumer electronics sector. You will be working very closely with the Lenovo category managers across the consumer products. This includes Windows PC (Notebook/ Desktop), Gaming, Chromebooks, Visuals, Android Tablets, and Accessories.
Working in the category team will give you an almost 360 view of the business, you will be working alongside many of the other parts of the business including sales, marketing, supply chain, operations, and finance. The successful candidate will join a high-performing team, and whilst the role is the junior position within the team you will be gain great experience of how the Lenovo Consumer business operates and pick up a good understanding of what other departments in the business do.
It will be a busy full-on schedule, and your role will be contributing significantly to the success of this business unit but will give you an excellent start and exposure to your career.
Important Attributes
* Good time management and organisational skills
* Good networking and relationship building
* Display positive attitude, assertive and determined
* Creative and adaptable
* Keen to learn and develop
* Eye for detail
* Confident with numbers and Microsoft excel
* Hunger to use data to make decisions
Minimum Requirements
* On course to achieve at least a 2:1 degree classification
* Undertaking a placement as part of your degree
This role will start in July 2023
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Breakthroughs in computing systems have made it possible to tackle immense obstacles in simulation. We're advancing our understanding of the world and universe at an exponential rate.
We're using supercomputers everywhere - from car and airplane design, oil field exploration, financial risk assessment, genome mapping to weather forecasting and essential research.
According to the Top500.org, we're the number-one supercomputer provider - including of some of the most sophisticated supercomputers in the world. With industry leading technology and global HPC architects and experts, we take a customer-centric approach to provide the HPC solutions that best meet our clients’ needs.
Shape the future of HPC & AI with us!
As Sales Executive/BDM, you will be responsible for selling the Lenovo High Performance Computing (HPC) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solution portfolio to clients, together with business partners as well as directly.
You will be accountable for revenue and profit objectives within your client set in KOREA, for developing and executing a sales pipeline of opportunities within your existing clients as well as for developing new prospects into clients in close collaboration with Lenovo’s sales teams in these countries.
You will be the focal point and representative for your clients for HPC and AI projects from a sales perspective. You will be supported by and working together with a strong and experienced team of HPC and AI commercial and technical experts and our various AP-J and global experts.
You will be working with a world-wide team of HPC and AI experts to translate the objectives of your clients into Lenovo’s development plans.
In High Performance Computing and AI, you will be at the forefront of future technologies helping your clients solve highly compute and data intensive challenges in their industry and grand challenges of humankind.
Ever wanted a driver seat in the Formula 1 or Formula E? Here’s your driver seat in the Formula 1 or E of IT!
These are your day-to-day responsibilities:
Identify new HPC & AI opportunities by understanding your clients’ objectives, success factors, requirements and project plans in a strong team with your technical and commercial peers.
Progress opportunities by consulting your clients based on our HPC & AI solution portfolio, including future technologies and developments, and by working with key stakeholders and decision makers from your clients.
Teaming with your Lenovo colleagues and business partners to prepare and submit convincing high-quality proposals, working with your technical peers to turn their solution configurations into competitively priced & winning solutions.
Ensuring in your daily interactions with clients that we meet and exceed their expectations, e.g. by coordinating with our global supply chain team for on time deliveries and with technical support, if needed to resolve even complex issues swiftly
Nurturing your eco system with key OEMs such as AMD, Intel, and NVIDIA to team up in the market for exciting new developments and joint go-to-market activities
Superior Teamwork
:
You will be joining a successful, highly reputed and motivated team of sales and technical HPC & AI professionals. We are spread out over Asia Pacific , working as a tight & super trustful team, backing each other, while enjoying what we do.
You will be working flexibly from the Lenovo office, or from your home office - by phone, by video conference and in personal meetings with your clients. Hence the location is flexible and advertised across different cities and countries.
We will help you getting up to speed by working with us and learning on the job in the team.
Organization
You will report to the Director of High Performance Computing and AI for Asia Pacific. supporting customers in KOREA. You will participate in weekly collaborative planning calls and meetings.
What you’ll bring/ Position Requirements:
10+ years’ experience and proven record of accomplishment in selling IT solutions, preferably including networking and/or storage to some solution complexity
Previous experience in the areas of HPC and AI is mandatory
Fully fluent in English in a business context
Ability to build effective virtual teams and drive results via others in a complex cross-functional organization.
Knowledge & strong interest in IT technology, esp. in servers, storage, networking with keen focus on market trends and customer needs with analytical skills and financial acumen.
Good organizational skills, a self-starter who has experience in managing multiple initiatives simultaneously, passion for start-up like environment.

We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
www.lenovo.com
, and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
Description and Requirements
You now have the opportunity to join our DACH team as a Partner Relationship Manager!
The position sits with the Channel Solutions and Services (CSS) team and their core objective is to support the sales through the channel network by providing financing solutions for business partner clients who are purchasing products and services directly from Lenovo.
Channel Solutions and Services overview:
Although only a relatively small team within Lenovo, CSS is responsible for the collection and risk management of nearly $4bn of Lenovo financial assets at any point in time.
We support Business Partners and IT suppliers across 60+ countries in 23 languages, with continued expansion to additional countries and are a major contributor to Lenovo’s Treasury operation.
CSS is regarded as a business within Lenovo and a profit centre.
Your overall focus in this function will be to:
Support the objectives of all areas of the Lenovo business in the market and with the clients that you are responsible for.
Identify and progress new opportunities within the current parameters of the business.
Monitor and protect Lenovo’s financial assets.
Your Key Responsibilities include to:
Report detailed status of sales opportunities to Lenovo management using appropriate tools
Ensure all opportunities are approved by the Lenovo support functions and ensure that all deal conditions are met prior to funding.
Work with the Account Specialists, support the management of a large/complex account portfolio operating under multiple financing programs and representing varying degrees of risk.
Build effective relationships with key individuals in the clients supported at all level
Proactively communicate with the Lenovo Channel organisation and sales teams.
Monitor clients for ongoing program compliance and take appropriate action in instances of      noncompliance.
Clearly and accurately document all customer communications.
Financial Responsibility:
Individual deal volumes may exceed $200m dollars annually and outstanding balances across the portfolio may total as much as $4bn. This role will be target based and remuneration will be dependent on achievement of sales and business development targets.
Required skills, education and experience:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and English are required
Consultative sales skills will be required and attendance on Lenovo Sales School will be a requisite for this role.
Thorough knowledge of finance, accounting, business administration, and secured lending principles as typically acquired through a bachelor's degree program or through relevant Lenovo or industry experience.
A significant degree of analytical and organizational skills will be required.  Must be creative in developing new plans and methods to meet client business needs and also to have the drive and tenacity to gain approvals and support from Lenovo Channel support functions.
Requirement to perform financial and business plan analysis, articulate procedures and lending concepts to others, and develop, recommend, and implement action plans as needed with only minimal management direction.  A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a client contact financial services position is desirable.
Ability to apply creativity and sound judgment to the design and implementation of portfolio management strategies to maximize customer satisfaction and minimize risk to Lenovo and customers.
What we offer
A multitude of professional and personal development opportunities
An very open and flexible work environment within one of the most forwarding thinking IT companies
Ultra flat structures, fast decision-making processes and a constant focus on customer requirements
An international team with a high focus on diversity & inclusion
Attractive compensation package
…and a lot of fun: We like to celebrate our successes!
Check out our Kununu profile if you would like to know more.
When applying for this position, please send your CV (including covering letter and references) via our Online-Tool. At Lenovo we are proud to be an equal opportunity company. This vacancy certainly applies for people with disabilities, too.

CA intern with good finance background who will be appearing for May'24 CA finals
Job Description for the R&D/BU Expense – CA Industrial Trainee
This position will assist the BU Finance Manager and the R&D Business Operations team with the short- and long-term planning processes for our research and development (R&D) organization. The key objective is to ensure the global R&D budget is allocated across all areas based on our portfolio roadmap.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
• Assist the Global R&D finance leader for the Mobile Business Group
• Co-work with the R&D Finance organization on all activities related to the annual plan, forecast and accounting close activities.
• Focus on reporting and analysis as it relates to onsite labor, prototype material, Tooling, NRE and Occupancy.
• Partner with the BU Expense team to identify cost reduction opportunities and improve efficiency.
• Prepare monthly and quarterly financial reports as required to measure spend by product and by function.
• Track, analyze and report on R&D investments, specifically ROI related to investments.
• Responsible for R&D Finance Dashboards.
• Ensure the right controls are in place to reduce the overall risk for Motorola.

Why Work at Lenovo
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.
Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #217 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.
This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit
www.lenovo.com
, and read about the latest news via our
StoryHub
.
Description and Requirements
At Lenovo, we strive to put more innovation in the hands of more people so they can do more amazing things. We are seeking enthusiastic, career-minded professionals to join our Inside Infrastructure Solutions Group (ISG) Sales Team.
This role is going to report to APJ Inside Sales Director based in Malaysia supporting APJ countries including Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Australia, New Zealand, India, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, Taiwan and more.
Position Description:
1. Responsible for uncovering opportunities, selling the benefits of the full Lenovo ISG Product Portfolio (including including Server, Storage, SDI, Networking, Software, DataCenter Solutions & Services), and selling against the competition.
2. Consistently to perform both detailed ISG related Data Center solution presentations and demonstrations via phone, computer, or a combination of both (Webex, TEAM, Zoom etc) with customers.
3. Configure, price, negotiate and quote sales solutions as well as provide, proactive follow-up, product information and overall account support via the telephone.
4. Leads sales and customer relationship on Named accounts (defined Sales territory) for ISG products & services.
5. Work within corporate initiatives including weekly forecast, opportunity management (discovery, progression, conversion) in line with Sales Plans.
6. Effectively partners with Alliance Partners and subject matter Experts in a way that brings energy and focus to simplify sales execution and move the business forward.
7. Collaborate with Partner ecosystem to ensure sales execution (on Sales territory) in alignment with Partner Ecosystem rules and definitions (driving own Sales territory & strategy in line with sales plans).
8. Support and co-ordinate post-sales activities as appropriate for Customer Experience.
9. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure sales activities are successfully on execution.
Position Requirements:
1. Ability to learn and present DataCenter Solution portfolio. Experience in a fast-paced, high-velocity technical organization.
2. Passion and understanding of the sales process.  Must have the ability to penetrate, acquire, and transition opportunities. High level of interpersonal skills and strong negotiation skills   High level of flexibility and self-reliance. Goal-oriented.
3. Sound phone skills. English verbal and written communication skills are required.  Multilingual (Mandarin, Tagalog, Malay, Japanese, Korea) will be advantage.  We welcome international candidates who interested in working in Malaysia.
4. With Computer Science and Business background is a plus.
What you will get:
1. A multicultural and diversified team with colleagues and peers from diverse nationality and background from Asia Pacific working in central center of excellence. Opportunities to collaborate with the field sales team, partners and customers in the respective APJ countries.
2. Opportunities to learn the technologies & IT solutions that address the human challenges.
3. Career path within the organization and within industry. Opportunities to widen the individual industry network with the collaboration with technologies partners and alliance.
